name: New Orleans (Mardi Gras)
description: Mardi Gras, meaning "Fat Tuesday" in French, is celebrated as a period of excess and revelry before the Christian fasting season of Lent. It marks the last day to enjoy rich foods, particularly meat, before the Lenten period begins. Celebrations often involve parades, parties, and feasting, as people indulge in pleasures they plan to give up during Lent.

name: Hamptons
description: The Hamptons, part of the East End of Long Island, consist of the towns of Southampton and East Hampton, which together compose the South Fork of Long Island, in Suffolk County, New York. The Hamptons are a popular seaside resort and one of the historical summer colonies of the northeastern United States.

description: The Catskill Mountains lie in southeastern New York State. The area is known for the Catskill Forest Preserve, with its rich wildlife and hiking trails, and ski resorts including Hunter Mountain and Belleayre Mountain.

name: Lake George
description:
Lake George captures your soul. Soothes body and mind. Inspires art, music and healthy living. Makes memories that last forever.
Lake George is located at the southern end of the famed Adirondack Park in Upstate New York. It is considered to be among the clearest and cleanest large lakes in the world. Formed nearly 10,000 years ago by melting glaciers, the Lake’s water clarity and scenic beauty have awed residents and visitors alike for centuries. More than 90% of the watershed remains as natural forestland, with nearly half of the forested acreage publicly owned by New York State and constitutionally protected as forever-wild Forest Preserve. Adding to its allure, Lake George is a headwater lake, fed by dozens of mountain streams and dotted with more than 170 islands of varying shapes and sizes.
direction:
Train: AMTRAK (800-872-7245) runs routes from New York City to Montreal with 2 daily stops in Fort Edward, about 20 minutes from the Lake George Area.
Car: 3 - 4 hrs

description: Montauk, New York, is a village at the east end of the Long Island peninsula. It’s known for its beaches, like Ditch Plains, with its strong Atlantic surf. At the peninsula’s tip, Montauk Point State Park is home to the 1796 Montauk Point Lighthouse.

name: Vermont
description: Vermont is a state in the northeastern United States, known for its natural landscape, which is primarily forested. Part of the New England region, it's also known for being home to more than 100 19th-century covered wooden bridges, and as a major producer of maple syrup. Thousands of acres of mountain terrain are crossed by hiking trails and skiing slopes.
direction:
